intro: Eriocaulon decangulare f. latifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved rice sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are broader than the typical variety, giving it a distinct appearance. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
